answers.answer: I heard codeine is a no no, but that's only word of mouth. If your doc knows your pregnant and gave you it I wouldn't be concerned. If you really are not sure call the pharmacy, and ask if it's safe to take in pregnancy.
Hey thanks i read on line some females said thy took it and nxt sono the baby wasnt alive :( thats y im scared... id just rather deal with the pain bettr safe thn sorry ya know??

Reading things like that are always scary! I had extreme head aches at first as well and I didn't take anything! I was to scared, even though Tylenol is safe during pregnancy.. I don't take anything unless I absolutely have to. But I'm not sure when it comes to codeine, especially in your first trimester. Maybe call your doc office in the am and explain your concerns, that might help. Or take normal Tylenol Sit on the edge of your tub with your feet in hot water and an ice pack on your head.. that helps. I found around the second trimester my headaches went away, it has to do with the hormone cocktail your body is going through

Aww thanks so much u made me feel relieved ive been stressin with my headaches for a while i thought maybe i had a brain tumor n.went to er and the dr said u dnt wana get a cat scan.bein preg its bad and i didnt hav no signs or tumor. Thanks alot though

T3s are fine in pregnancy. With my first i had to take them for severe migraines due to preeclampsia. And also i have needed vicodin since i needed kidney surgery while pregnant.My son turned out just fine. No problem.
Its on the list of approved pain killers my doc gave me. :-)

question: So i posted couple days ago bout my severe migrains i finally went to my first prenatal appt foundout i was 10 weeks not 12. He presc me tylenol 3 which has codeine in it he said its safe but im kinda scared to take it :( will somebody let me know if its safe??
title: TYLENOL 3 SAFE??
